Issues.Title: vue-server-renderer: Allow camelCased SSR directives
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Currently, SSR directives can be only passed in with 'kebab-case' keys. This isn't denoted anywhere (except in the tests, luckily!) and not "intuitive" as they can be provided as camelCased ones on the client as well.

Can we introduce camelCased SSR directives?
I'd be available to work on the impl.

### What does the proposed API look like?
```js
directives: {
  classPrefixer: (node, dir) => {/*...*/}
}
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "vue-server-renderer: Allow camelCased SSR directives" (#8961)

Issues.Title: Regexp: optimize & sort
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Regexp: optimize & sort" (#8960)

Issues.Title: Remove element during preTransformNode
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
We have a Mobile build and a Web build, and we want to add a directive `mobile` or `web` to components/elements so that they only get included into the bundle if they are built with the respective flags / env.

Currently we are doing this via a vue-cli plugin which executes `preprocess` on the template (using a custom loader). We tried using `directives` and `modules` in `compilerOptions` instead, as this seemed safer and more idiomatic, however we were unable to remove elements using any of the callbacks.

### What does the proposed API look like?
We tried returning `null` and `{}` and even `{ type: 3, text: "", isComment: true }` from `preTransformNode` (and `transformNode`), but it just resulted in various errors. We also tried changing `el.parent.children` which didn't yield any results.

I think having the element just be removed when returning `null` from `preTransformNode` would be great, if that is possible.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Remove element during preTransformNode" (#8959)

Issues.Title: Uncaught TypeError: Object.entries is not a function on OSX
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.17

### Reproduction link
[https://beautysalonfiore.be](https://beautysalonfiore.be)





### Steps to reproduce
I'm having this problem on OSX. On Windows, Android and Linux I don't encounter this problem. I have tried to rebuild it. Google it, found alot of non Vue related issues. It doesn't work on an iPad aswell. However on an iPhone it does. What's most likely this problem?

This project is build with vue-cli 3.0.5.

### What is expected?
That the bundle to work on OSX

### What is actually happening?
I gives a TypeError: Object.entries is not a function on OSX

---
It used to work fine. Until one build started to show errors on just Apple related products except the iPhone. I haven't found any issue related to this. I'm willing to share source code if necessary.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: Typings: Improve $scopedSlots type to prevent unchecked access to undefined
Issues.Body:
<!--
Please make sure to read the Pull Request Guidelines:
https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines
-->

<!-- PULL REQUEST TEMPLATE -->
<!-- (Update "[ ]" to "[x]" to check a box) -->

**What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (check at least one)

- [x] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update
- [ ] Refactor
- [ ] Build-related changes
- [ ] Other, please describe:

**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?** (check one)

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

If yes, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications:

**The PR fulfills these requirements:**

- [x] It's submitted to the `dev` branch for v2.x (or to a previous version branch), _not_ the `master` branch
- [ ] When resolving a specific issue, it's referenced in the PR's title (e.g. `fix #xxx[,#xxx]`, where "xxx" is the issue number)
- [x] All tests are passing: https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#development-setup
- [x] New/updated tests are included

If adding a **new feature**, the PR's description includes:
- [ ] A convincing reason for adding this feature (to avoid wasting your time, it's best to open a suggestion issue first and wait for approval before working on it)

**Other information:**

When working directly with render functions in TypeScript / tsx, currently the following code is unsafe and unchecked by the ts compiler:

```ts
this.$sopedSlots.default() // default can be undefined
```

The change in this PR makes TypeScript complain about the unsafe access accordingly and the code has to be expressed in a way that prevents calling an undefined function, e.g.:

```ts
( this.$scopedSlots.default || ( () => 'default value' ) )( props )
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Typings: Improve $scopedSlots type to prevent unchecked access to undefined" (#8946)

Issues.Title: perf(deps): improve the order to teardown watcher from O(n*m) to O(n) (fix vuex#1383)
Issues.Body:
<!--
Please make sure to read the Pull Request Guidelines:
https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines
-->

<!-- PULL REQUEST TEMPLATE -->
<!-- (Update "[ ]" to "[x]" to check a box) -->

**What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (check at least one)

- [ ] Bugfix
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Code style update
- [ ] Refactor
- [ ] Build-related changes
- [x] Other, please describe: performance improvement

**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?** (check one)

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

If yes, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications:

**The PR fulfills these requirements:**

- [x] It's submitted to the `dev` branch for v2.x (or to a previous version branch), _not_ the `master` branch
- [x] When resolving a specific issue, it's referenced in the PR's title (e.g. `fix #xxx[,#xxx]`, where "xxx" is the issue number)
- [x] All tests are passing: https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#development-setup
- [x] New/updated tests are included

If adding a **new feature**, the PR's description includes:
- [ ] A convincing reason for adding this feature (to avoid wasting your time, it's best to open a suggestion issue first and wait for approval before working on it)

**Other information:**
This PR fixes vuejs/vuex#1383.

Simplified reproduction / benchmark: https://github.com/ktsn/vue-deps-perf-demo
The demo will destroy 1000 components that has a computed property depends on an array with 1000 length. Then print its time.

On my machine, the result is like the following:
current: 3434ms
patched: 224ms

On the current reactive system implementation, when a computed property depends on an array, its children object will also be registered to computed property's watcher as dependency.

When the watcher is torndown, the watcher iterates its dependencies (size `n`). The dependencies remove the watcher from their watcher list (size `m`). So it will cost O(n*m).

So it would become slow if there are many computed properties and a large array.

This PR change the watcher list in `Dep` object to object map to make the order linear. The entire order of the watcher teardown will be O(n).

There may be more overhead on `delete` operator. I'm not sure how it affects actual application though.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "perf(deps): improve the order to teardown watcher from O(n*m) to O(n) (fix vuex#1383)" (#8944)

---
I suspect that the issue occur becuse for some reason the browser treat hebrew with IME.
There has to be a way around it. maybe by a modifier that will trigger the update for native input.

Issues.Title: Child transitions are triggered when the parent element is hidden
Issues.Body:
### Version
2.5.17

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/BryceBarbara/kv7espnq/](https://jsfiddle.net/BryceBarbara/kv7espnq/)

### Steps to reproduce
1. Click the "Toggle Screen" button.
2. See that the first screen's content is faded out while the second screen's content is already visible.

### What is expected?
I would expect the transition to not trigger due to the fact that the parent has been hidden and does not have a transition on it.

### What is actually happening?
The child element on the first screen is faded out after the second screen's content is already visible.

---
I assume this is some sort of element re-use situation because adding a key to either the first or second screen elements fixes it. I'm reporting this mainly to call attention to something that doesn't _seem_ intentional and that has very little information on it.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Child transitions are triggered when the parent element is hidden" (#8926)

Issues.Title: fix #8862: cannot watch unicode properties like 'a.‰∏≠Êñá'
Issues.Body:
Hi all at Vue!

This pull request resolves the issue regarding watchers not watching unicode properties like 'a.‰∏≠Êñá'.

My method for resolving this case is to throw a warning when non-alphanumeric, $, or _ characters are detected. My reasoning behind throwing a warning instead of supporting special characters is that I think  supporting special characters would promote poor naming habits that could only make code more difficult to read and understand.

I'm pretty new to open source so any feedback would be awesome and please let me know if you'd like to see any changes or improvements!

Link to issue: https://github.com/vuejs/vue/issues/8862

Issues.Title: setting object1 from another object (object2,)  object1 overwrites the original one (object2) when object1 is modified

### Steps to reproduce
Make two variables with the same keys, call them obejct1 and object2.
If I write object1 = object2 anywhere in my code, after modifying object1's any values, objec2's value will be overwritten.
But if I write object1.key1 = objec2.key1 and object1.key2 = object2.key2 then I can modify anything in object1, object2 will not change.

### What is expected?
modifying object1 won't modify object2

### What is actually happening?
modifying object1 modifies object2

Issues.Body:
Hello every one.
I have question .

```
 btnEdit(id) {

Issues.Title: Is there any way to force navigation when clicking on a router-link even if the route doesn't change?
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Reload current page's state or refresh the page.

For example, I have a `<HeaderBar>` which contains a `Home` button, just like the Facebook one.
If I'm in another page (rather than Home), when I hit this button, it will navigate to Home. But when I'm in Home page, hit this button it does nothing.

It's expected to reload the page, and scroll to the top, right?

Please don't tell me to write out an action to refresh the state and scroll to top. This header bar is a shared component, and the Home button can be hit at any where.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Some thing like 
```vue
<router-link :to="{ name: 'Home', force: true }">Home</router-link>
```
or
```js
this.$router.replace({ name: 'Home', force: true });
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Is there any way to force navigation when clicking on a router-link even if the route doesn't change?" (#2430)

Issues.Title: Fix dates inside query objects being converted to empty objects while cloning
Issues.Body: It happens that you want to add a Date as a query parameter. However, when creating the route, the query object is cloned. The clone function does not support dates since it converts dates to objects. This fix clones the Date in a separate conditional branch.

Issues.Title: [Docs] HTML5 History Mode Caveat Clarification
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://router.vuejs.org/guide/essentials/history-mode.html#caveat](https://router.vuejs.org/guide/essentials/history-mode.html#caveat)





### Steps to reproduce
The documentation correctly states that using history mode and configuring the server with a catch-all fallback route has the caveat that the server will no longer report 404 errors. It says "To get around the issue, you should implement a catch-all route within your Vue app to show a 404 page". In my opinion, that wording implies that implementing a catch-all route within Vue completely fixes the problem. However, with that approach, if a user goes to an invalid URL, the server will respond with a status code of 200 even though the URL is invalid. On some sites (especially dynamic ones), there is a good chance that a URL that is valid today could be invalid tomorrow. Maybe some search engines are smart enough to recognize that it's a "Page Not Found" page and treat it as such rather than a valid URL, but I'm guessing that not all search engines are that smart. I think it's important for developers to be aware of this, so I think it would be a good addition to the "Essentials > HTML5 History Mode >  Caveat" documentation.

### What is expected?
The documentation should mention that the server will respond with a status code of 200 for invalid URLs.

### What is actually happening?
The documentation does not mention this.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Docs] HTML5 History Mode Caveat Clarification" (#2418)

Issues.Title: Register router-link and router-view with PascalCase for style guide compatibility
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
The Vue style guide recommends using PascalCase for Vue components in templates. However, since the components are registerd using kebab-case, you can't use PascalCase in the templates:
```
  Vue.component('router-view', View);
  Vue.component('router-link', Link);
```

In contrast, they're registered with kebab-case, you'd be able to use them with either kebab-case, or PascalCase:

```
  Vue.component('RouterView', View);
  Vue.component('RouterLink', Link);
```

This is the related style guide recommendation: https://vuejs.org/v2/style-guide/#Component-name-casing-in-templates-strongly-recommended

### What does the proposed API look like?
```
<RouterView/>
<RouterLink to="/foo">Go to Foo</RouterLink>
```

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Register router-link and router-view with PascalCase for style guide compatibility" (#2409)

Issues.Title: Dynamic alias
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
With a route defined like this: 

```
{
    path: '/404',
    alias: '*',
    name: 'error',
    component: Error
}
```

When a user visit `my-site.com/random-inexisting-url`, the url doesn't change and it displays the error page. (this is what we want)

*** 

Now, how to to do the same with dynamic routes?

Example: 
- there is a route like `my-site.com/pages/:id` 
- the user visits `my-site.com/pages/inexisting-id`. 
- the `id` param is used to fetch an API. If the API returns null, there is no automatic redirection to the error page. 

It is possible to manually redirect to the `/error` page with `router.push({ name: 'error' })` or a navigation guard, but it will change the url to `/error`. 

**Is it possible to keep the original url, but still display the error page?** 



### What does the proposed API look like?
something like `router.aliasTo({name: 'error' })`

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Dynamic alias" (#2408)

Issues.Title: Forward args as props to custom child
Issues.Body:
When rendering a custom child ("tag" prop) forward unhandled args to the component, like a button or something complex.

I believe this will not break any existing functionality while giving some new capabilities.

Guess this will fix #1678 and can be related to #2029.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Forward args as props to custom child" (#2407)

If we accidentally set `to` prop of router-link to `null`, an error `TypeError: Cannot read property 'name' of null` will be thrown. 

At this line:
https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/blob/dev/src/util/location.js#L18

There should be a better error message but not just crash and leave users confused.



### What does the proposed API look like?

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Issues.Title: route will iframe changes the iframe then the page when hitting back
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://codepen.io/smakinson/pen/JaVbGv](https://codepen.io/smakinson/pen/JaVbGv)





### Steps to reproduce
Click the first PRESS ME link to move to the page with an iframe.

Notice the iframe and the VAL.

Click the next PRESS ME link.

Notice the iframe and the VAL.

Press the back button.

Notice the iframe and the VAL.

Press the back button again.

Notice the iframe and the VAL.

### What is expected?
Pressing the browser back button would go back to the previous route on the first press, not first affecting only the iframe.

### What is actually happening?
Pressing back in the browser first affects the iframe, then pressing again affects the route.

---
Reference issue: https://github.com/vuejs/vue-router/issues/1699

I came across this bug recently in a project I am working on that uses an iframe for video. I had only noticed the issue in Chrome initially, but the pen seems to show it happening in Firefox and Safari as well.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "route will iframe changes the iframe then the page when hitting back" (#2403)

Issues.Title: $router not available in function passed as prop (undefined is not an object)
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/rothsandro/vue-router-issue](https://github.com/rothsandro/vue-router-issue)





### Steps to reproduce
1. Clone the repo
2. Go into the repo folder
3. `npm install`
4. `npm run serve`
5. Open the app (http://localhost:8080/)
6. Click on the button

The parent component `HelloWorld` has a property `demo` with a function `run`, passed down to its child component `ChildComponent`. Clicking the button executes the run method in the child component.

The run method triggers four alerts:
1. Alert of a property of the class
2. Alert a property from the Vuex store
3. Alert the $router object using a method in the class
4. Alert using this.$router directly instead of a separate function




### What is expected?
You should see four alerts, number 3 and 4 should show "[object Object]".

### What is actually happening?
Only three alerts will be shown, number four produces the following error:

```
TypeError: undefined is not an object (evaluating 'this._routerRoot._router')
```

The same syntax using this.$store works fine. Therefore I assume the problem is related to Vue Router, not Vue or Typescript.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "$router not available in function passed as prop (undefined is not an object)" (#2401)

Issues.Title: Why encode '(' to 28%
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://abc.com/search?keyword=iPhone%20XS%20Max(A2104)%20%E5%9B%BD%E8%A1%8C%E7%89%88](https://abc.com/search?keyword=iPhone%20XS%20Max(A2104)%20%E5%9B%BD%E8%A1%8C%E7%89%88)





### Steps to reproduce
I use vue-router in ssr,in entry-server.js,got rejection
```javascript
    const { url } = context
    const { fullPath } = router.resolve(url).route

    if (fullPath !== url) {
      return reject({ url: fullPath })
    }
```
the URL is `/search?keyword=iPhone%20XS%20Max(A2104)%20%E5%9B%BD%E8%A1%8C%E7%89%88`
get fullPath in express by `req.url` is `/search?keyword=iPhone%20XS%20Max(A2104)%20%E5%9B%BD%E8%A1%8C%E7%89%88`
but in vue-router `route.fullPath` get `/search?keyword=iPhone%20XS%20Max%28A2104%29%20%E5%9B%BD%E8%A1%8C%E7%89%88`
the difference is vue-router encode '(' to 28% and ')' to 29%,why do this?

### What is expected?
don't endoce `!Ôºå 'Ôºå(Ôºå)Ôºå*Ôºå-Ôºå.Ôºå_Ôºå~Ôºå0-9Ôºåa-zÔºåA-Z`

### What is actually happening?
got error in ssr

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Why encode '(' to 28%" (#2400)

Issues.Title: It is possible to sync vuex state across devices?
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
I want to make the same user, authorized on different devices, interact with the site, when the state changes, so that it synchronously changes on all devices.

Back-Ender asks to implement the mechanism via *web sockets*   how-to about **change the state from the server(!)**. 
He says that in *react-redux* he calls action with *type* and some *payload*. 
But vuex has **two entities**: *mutations* and *actions*, which adds complexity! Especially when store is namespaced by modules.


### What does the proposed API look like?
  I would be grateful for any help.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "It is possible to sync vuex state across devices?" (#1424)

Issues.Title: Dynamic module generation - Nested modules doesn't have proper levels
Issues.Body:
### Version 3.0.1 ### Reproduction link [https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/749394/](https://jsfiddle.net/50wL7mdz/749394/) ### Steps to reproduce Run the program and check the console and the paragraph tag ### What is expected? 1. There should be two nested modules a and b in the console store[getters].
1.a The two modules should be namespaced with a/aa and b/aa 2. The first <p> tag should be undefined since namespace a was not given 3. Second <p> tag should get "module a/aa" 4. Third <p> tag should get "module b/aa" ### What is actually happening? 1. There is only one getter.(nested namespacing did not work)
1.a The getter is not namespaced by neither a nor b 2. The first <p> tag is giving value (not respecting namespace) 3. Second <p> tag is undefined since namespace is not registering properly 4. Third <p> tag is undefined since namespace is not registering properly --- But if u check the state property of the store object in the console, you can see the modules registered with the correct namespace.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Dynamic module generation - Nested modules doesn't have proper levels" (#1405)

Issues.Title: Support for IndexedDB
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
It should (in theory) make dealing with Big Data Web Visualizations easier and more performant.

I'm using echarts to render big data vizualizations at the company I work for. The problem is that when my data gets really big (1m records), It's takes way too long to do anything. The app pretty much becomes unresponsive and so now the only alternative I have is to do all of the aggregation on the backend and then return the response.

### What does the proposed API look like?
I would imagine that the vuex instance would send messages back and forth between the serviceworker and itself. The mutations could then be passed as arguments to the serviceworker. The serviceworker would perform the operation and return the aggregated data. If the user does not have third-party-cookies enabled. It would just fall back to the normal Vuex instance.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Support for IndexedDB" (#1416)

Issues.Title: Wrong data for getters at least in actions because getters are mutables
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/fqm3tj5y/3/](https://jsfiddle.net/fqm3tj5y/3/)

### Steps to reproduce
clic on "display values" text

### What is expected?
wrapper: values ===  getter: value

### What is actually happening?
wrapper: values !==  getter: value

---
I change the line 17
from 
       let begin = getters.begin
to 
       let begin = moment(getters.begin;)

And this works. 

Anyway, it seems to me that a getter should'nt change and be a copy in every call. If not this should be good documented with an big warning : " Attention : a getter is mutable, copy it, if you want to play with its ow properties."

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Wrong data for getters at least in actions because getters are mutables" (#1415)

Issues.Title: Add ability to turn off devtools on vuex by passing an off options
Issues.Body:
This PR adds the ability to turn off devtools on a per vuex instance level.  This is useful for cases where you have multiple vuex stores on a single page.  A good example is a scenario where teams maintain their own portions of a single app that are all loaded, some of which will have an independent vuex store.

With this option, on the dev side i could turn this off per instance so that I can debug a single store. 

By default, this mirrors what is already in vuex, it just allows for turning off when specified.

```
const store = new Vuex.Store({
  devtools: false
})
```

Follow through on https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/issues/875
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add ability to turn off devtools on vuex by passing an off options" (#1407)

Issues.Title: Add helpers to default export type declaration as in sources
Issues.Body:
Partially based on #1274
Import Vuex.
```ts
import Vuex from "vuex";
```
Using before this PR: 
```ts
(Vuex as any).mapActions(...)
```

Using after:
```
Vuex.mapActions(...)
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Add helpers to default export type declaration as in sources" (#1408)

Issues.Title: Remove TS type definition and move to DefinitelyTyped
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
#### Background:
It's hard to say TypeScript type definition development has been active in this repo. [Searching TypeScript tags](https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/labels/typescript), all 7 issues TS-related remain open, and 3 out of 5 PRs are waiting for reviewing, including one opened back in January 2018.

If the repository includes type definition, it would be nice if the repository maintainers are responsible for maintaining definition actively as well as library itself.

#### Suggestion:
Remove TypeScipt type definition in this repository, and move them to [DefinitelyTyped](https://github.com/DefinitelyTyped/DefinitelyTyped), so type definition development wouldn't be the tasks for Vuex maintainers. I would expect type definition development would be more active with this since it'll be easier to review/merge.

### What does the proposed API look like?
Type definition are removed. Users will have to install `@types/vuex`, but it will be more accurate/strict/up-to-date definition.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Remove TS type definition and move to DefinitelyTyped" (#1406)

Issues.Title: Typescript definition for interface Dispatch not correct -- should allow non-async return?
Issues.Body:
### Version 3.0.1 ### Reproduction link [https://jsfiddle.net/sjmcdowall/hzew29g1/](https://jsfiddle.net/sjmcdowall/hzew29g1/) ### Steps to reproduce Create a typescript Vue project with Vuex Use a fairly strict tslint that has "no-floating-promises" turned on Code a call to a store.dispatch() without await / async Promise stuff (i.e. normal sync. call) ### What is expected? No linting errors ### What is actually happening? tslint complains with ERROR: (no-floating-promises) /Users/sjm/work/mm/mms4/web-ui/src/app/router.ts[91, 5]: Promises must be handled appropriately on this code: store.dispatch('event/initState'); --- I think the interface for Dispatch needs to have more overrides to include the non-Promise versions that return : any ?? `export interface Dispatch { (type: string, payload?: any, options?: DispatchOptions): Promise;

(payloadWithType: P, options?: DispatchOptions): Promise; (type: string, payload?: any, options?: DispatchOptions): any;

(payloadWithType: P, options?: DispatchOptions): any; }` ??
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Typescript definition for interface Dispatch not correct -- should allow non-async return? " (#1403)

I was looking for some written news about this now for quite a time. Now we are setting up a new big project and we would really love to get a confirmation about this.
Thank you

Issues.Title: Registering Vuex hooks prevents vue rendering.
Issues.Body:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/Fachher/vuejsschool.git](https://github.com/Fachher/vuejsschool.git)





### Steps to reproduce
yarn run serve.
open browser and open http://localhost:8080
You will see that only the navigationbar is displayed but content is missing.

### What is expected?
See the content of each route

### What is actually happening?
content is not rendered

---
Removing hook methods from About.vue, Home.vue and ShipmentList.vue leads to working app. This means just adding the hooks does not lead to this behavior.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Registering Vuex hooks prevents vue rendering." (#1391)

Issues.Title: Vuex module helpers
Issues.Body:
### What problem does this feature solve?
Prevent wrong placement of mapping helpers in component.
I came across a trouble lately with coding calls to modules. I used the helpers but incorrectly. For example, I used an action helper in the computed part of my component. The issue was that it was called only once .

### What does the proposed API look like?
`mapActions(myComponent,["action1", "action2"])`

But to prevent any wrong insertion in the component, it would be convenient to register the component in the helpers instead of inserting the helpers in the component which is error prone.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Vuex module helpers" (#1393)

Issues.Title: Vuex module helpers
Issues.Body:
Hi,

I would to propose an enhancement. I came across a trouble lately with coding calls to modules. I used the helpers but incorrectly. For example, I used an action helper in the computed part of my component. The issue was that it was called only once ... But to prevent any wrong insertion in the component, it would be convenient to register the component in the helpers instead of inserting the helpers in the component which is error prone. Why not something like : 
`mapActions(myComponent,["action1", "action2"])`
It would insert correctly the helpers in the component.
Have a nice day.

Ivan Matmati
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Vuex module helpers" (#1392)
